message_1: A researcher wants to determine the average weight of a certain breed of dogs. He selects 10 dogs at random and records their weights in pounds as 75, 85, 78, 90, 92, 80, 73, 89, 83, and 88. What is the sample mean weight of the dogs?
message_2:
To find the sample mean weight of the dogs, you need to add up all the weights and then divide by the number of dogs.

The sum of the weights is: 75 + 85 + 78 + 90 + 92 + 80 + 73 + 89 + 83 + 88 = 833

There are 10 dogs in the sample, so the sample mean weight is:

833 / 10 = 83.3 pounds

The sample mean weight of the dogs is 83.3 pounds.
